Description: Details: I checked the serial number on the head-stock and dated this guitar back to 2000 using "The Guitar Dater Project"https://www.guitardaterproject.org/ibanez.aspx Your guitar was made at the Fuji-gen Plant, Japan in 2000 Production Number: 2977 You can also cross-check this with the Ibanez wiki-page: http://ibanez.wikia.com/wiki/RG7420_(2000-2002) I mainly bought this guitar because I'm obsessed with 7 string guitars and specifically Japanese made 7 string guitars. This was a chance to own a beautiful piece of history and I had to have it. Sadly, I don't play music anymore and I can't afford to have so many instruments so this is the one that has to go. I'm not the first owner of this guitar. It had the Seymour Duncan 7 string pickups when I bought it. It was well set up when I purchased it and immediately playable which is also why I haven't had a chance to remove the pickups and see what model pickups they are. But even the cheapest Seymour Duncan 7 string pickups are around $200. I tune half a step down so the guitar is currently set up for that tuning. But as with all floating tremolo instruments, you'll need to adjust the tremolo when you re-adjust the tuning. I bought 2 new tremolo springs (original parts from Ibanez) but will ship the previous springs too. I prefer the tension on the new springs for my tuning. It ships with the gig-bag seen in the pictures. I also made some D.I.Y tremolo-stoppers using some wood and tape. Happy to ship those out too. They're surprisingly effective and easy to slide in and out of the tremolo cavity if needed. I will also ship the tremolo bar that came with the guitar. I'll also throw in a planet-waves locking strap because I'm nice. Condition:The guitar is 18 years old so I don't recommend purchasing this guitar if you're looking for a brand new instrument. This guitar is in perfect playing condition but cosmetically has a bunch of dings and dents. I tried to capture as many of the significant dings as I could in the last image. I WILL NOT ACCEPT RETURNS on shipped orders so please ask as many questions and request more pictures if you need to before purchasing it. If you're local to Philadelphia I would prefer a local pickup and I'm happy to offer returns. I am skeptical of all shipping agencies but will ship with whatever method you wish at your cost.
Title: Ibanez RG7420 7 String Guitar Seymour Duncan Pickup Magenta Japan Fuji-gen 2000

NameValueList.Name: Modification Description
Value: The guitar has been upgraded with a set of new Seymour Duncan pickups. I'm not sure which model pickups are in there but the cheapest pair of SD pickups is around $220 minimum.

ConditionDescription: This is an 18 year old guitar with cosmetic damages and dents. Works perfectly fine and comes with new pickups.
